content: ... don't mean to disrespect but my wife & I BOTH thought Obama looked "stoned" the other night on 60-minutes... Seriously, the man looked like he had a nice buzz-on to me... and that isn't said as slam - just my observation... Ya know what makes it so disappointing is – it is becoming so obvious that he is WAY in over his head. He has nothing to offer – and it shows more & more every time he starts down a path… All he is doing is turning the dial to SPIN – then flicking the switch. Sadly, the shallowness that was poking its head up once in a while during the campaign is PAINFULLY obvious now… Just my humble opinion – but He has no convictions – he reminds me as one of those smart-@$$ college professors who glides through the holy halls of (so-called) higher education – but doesn’t really know jack – crap about anything other than whatever fills the shallow slots of his brain. He’s what is called a “loss-leader” in business… the product that is used to bring them in but all that’s really happening is – they are trying to unload some dead-freaking inventory – so the mark it below cost to get rid of it… That is SAD – but that fits Obama to a T… He is so far out of his league folks better pay serious attention because HE IS NOT – and he knows it! He’s one of those guys that always whines and complains about the boss. Then one day the boss says, hey dude – it’s all yours for a week – don’t let me down… The boss comes back (knowing it will be a mess) and sure enough – 2-3 people quit – equipment is down and hey where’s the bone that was left in charge – oh, he’s still trying to talk a few guys in to coming back in because they quit too… Obama’s inexperience is glowing so hot right about now – the Soviet’s satellite nuclear detectors are probably buzzing off the meters… Sorry – but Bush obviously had a difficult time speaking in front of the mic – and now it appears as though ole fast-Eddy does too… Funny how those little things like EMPTY VOID inside tend to catch up with folks… I just hope we survive it now… We are on a greased skid to socialism and he’s determined to trust his college rebel socialist magazines that made him look cool but were nothing more than liberal’s wet-dream in fantasy land … What a sad disappointment. Maybe Colin Powell will go in an slap him into a reality… If not – well, here comes the PESO-DOLLAR - 400-dollars for a loaf of bread… oh but don’t worry we’ll all be making 500-800 thousand dollars a year – the bummer is – McDonalds Happy Meals will cost about 1000-bucks …. PESO – lego –my Peso - ….

The president unexpectedly vetoed the bill after signaling earlier that he might sign it. Only days before the veto the president was seeking reassurance that the Securities and Exchange Commission would take administrative measures to protect the interests of small investors, according to White House aides. SEC chairman Arthur Levitt endorsed a safe harbor provision to shield companies from the legal liability for incorrect predictions. American Institute of CPAs key persons, state CPA societies and national CPA firms urged members of Congress to support the reforms in the bill. "The passage of the securities legislation is a tremendous victory for both business and the CPA profession," said Barry C. Melancon, AICPA president. "The AICPA key persons program and the Accountants Coalition, a coalition of national CPA firms, deserve tremendous credit for the effort and support given to achieve this goal." content: ... don't mean to disrespect but my wife & I BOTH thought Obama looked "stoned" the other night on 60-minutes... Seriously, the man looked like he had a nice buzz-on to me... and that isn't said as slam - just my observation... Ya know what makes it so disappointing is – it is becoming so obvious that he is WAY in over his head. He has nothing to offer – and it shows more & more every time he starts down a path… All he is doing is turning the dial to SPIN – then flicking the switch. Sadly, the shallowness that was poking its head up once in a while during the campaign is PAINFULLY obvious now… Just my humble opinion – but He has no convictions – he reminds me as one of those smart-@$$ college professors who glides through the holy halls of (so-called) higher education – but doesn’t really know jack – crap about anything other than whatever fills the shallow slots of his brain. He’s what is called a “loss-leader” in business… the product that is used to bring them in but all that’s really happening is – they are trying to unload some dead-freaking inventory – so the mark it below cost to get rid of it… That is SAD – but that fits Obama to a T… He is so far out of his league folks better pay serious attention because HE IS NOT – and he knows it! He’s one of those guys that always whines and complains about the boss. Then one day the boss says, hey dude – it’s all yours for a week – don’t let me down… The boss comes back (knowing it will be a mess) and sure enough – 2-3 people quit – equipment is down and hey where’s the bone that was left in charge – oh, he’s still trying to talk a few guys in to coming back in because they quit too… Obama’s inexperience is glowing so hot right about now – the Soviet’s satellite nuclear detectors are probably buzzing off the meters… Sorry – but Bush obviously had a difficult time speaking in front of the mic – and now it appears as though ole fast-Eddy does too… Funny how those little things like EMPTY VOID inside tend to catch up with folks… I just hope we survive it now… We are on a greased skid to socialism and he’s determined to trust his college rebel socialist magazines that made him look cool but were nothing more than liberal’s wet-dream in fantasy land … What a sad disappointment. Maybe Colin Powell will go in an slap him into a reality… If not – well, here comes the PESO-DOLLAR - 400-dollars for a loaf of bread… oh but don’t worry we’ll all be making 500-800 thousand dollars a year – the bummer is – McDonalds Happy Meals will cost about 1000-bucks …. PESO – lego –my Peso - ….

The Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 was drafted to reshape securities laws that professional investors and some class-action lawyers have used against corporations, accountants and securities underwriters to win billions of dollars in damages. The president unexpectedly vetoed the bill after signaling earlier that he might sign it. Only days before the veto the president was seeking reassurance that the Securities and Exchange Commission would take administrative measures to protect the interests of small investors, according to White House aides. SEC chairman Arthur Levitt endorsed a safe harbor provision to shield companies from the legal liability for incorrect predictions. American Institute of CPAs key persons, state CPA societies and national CPA firms urged members of Congress to support the reforms in the bill. "The passage of the securities legislation is a tremendous victory for both business and the CPA profession," said Barry C. Melancon, AICPA president. "The AICPA key persons program and the Accountants Coalition, a coalition of national CPA firms, deserve tremendous credit for the effort and support given to achieve this goal." Perhaps the bill's strongest supporter in Congress, Senator Christopher J.
